page.title: 18HEREFORD-GLOUCESTER CANAL
page.content:
The line of the former Hereford and Gloucester canal traverses the northwest corner of the area and many features of the abandoned canal can still be seen.
A road bridge exists at Grid reference 523419 and the course of the old canal can be seen to the south and west of this bridge.
The alignment can also be seen beside the minor road leading to Sutton St. Nicholas.
Much of the embankment which carried the canal across the River Lugg has been removed in recent years together with the aqueduct at Grid reference 533438, to alleviate flooding.
